text.section: The board may establish one or more regional offices and provide staff as necessary to perform functions as prescribed by the board.
The board may establish regional advisory boards consisting of representatives of government, private business, communities, and higher education; and prescribe their functions and responsibilities.
The board may contract with existing economic development agencies as necessary to perform functions as prescribed by the board.

law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 105, sec. 15, effective July 14, 1992.
